revised_title: Observations of a Fire-Ball and Explosion in the Sky
tldr: The author describes witnessing a fire-ball in the sky and subsequent explosion on December 11, 1741. The fire-ball was observed to be oval in shape, with a diameter of about a yard and a half. It appeared to descend from above and took its course to the east, leaving a trail of smoke in its wake. The event concluded with a cloud forming and assuming different colors.
